DOC.brief_summary: This observational pilot study supernormal oxygen delivery goal patient proximal femoral fracture .
DOC.detailed_description: Augmentation oxygen delivery use fluid without inotropes show improve surgical outcome high-risk patient . Patients proximal femoral fracture consider high risk . However , cohort elderly patient poor cardiovascular condition may achieve oxygen delivery goal . We perform observational pilot study whether supernormal oxygen delivery valid hemodynamic goal patient proximal femoral fracture .
DOC.criteria: Patients age 70 yr Weight 35 kg Underwent proximal femur fracture ( PFF ) surgery peripheral nerve block laryngeal mask airway anesthesia . Patients could harm due treatment ( ongoing myocardial infarction , chronic dialysis ) Monoamine oxidase inhibitor use within last 14 day Pathological fracture condition Inability give inform consent ( judge research team member ) Anticipated difficulty obtain data first postoperative year ( judge research team member )
